channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Supreme Court upholds key Obamacare measure on preventive care

item.title: Supreme Court limits nationwide injunctions in birthright citizenship order

item.title: What to know about the Supreme Court's birthright citizenship case
item.description: It is considering whether a single federal judge can block a nationwide order from the US president.

item.title: Iranian foreign minister admits serious damage to nuclear sites
item.description: Abbas Araghchi also says there are no plans to resume nuclear talks with the US.

item.title: Syrian charged over plot to attack Taylor Swift Vienna concert
item.description: A young Syrian national is suspected of supporting a foreign terror group over a foiled plot in Vienna last August.

item.title: What to know about Jeff Bezos' and Lauren Sanchez's 3-day wedding
item.description: Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sanchez's glitzy three-day wedding celebration kicks off this Thursday in Venice. Not everyone is pleased.

item.title: Tehran is coming back to life, but its residents are deeply shaken
item.description: As Iran's capital resumes its old rhythms, the BBC's Lyse Doucet meets locals who wonder if peace will last.

item.title: Sean "Diddy" Combs' lawyer calls music mogul's prosecution a "fake trial"
item.description: The prosecution in Sean "Diddy" Combs' trial made their closing arguments Thursday, after calling on 34 witnesses over the course of seven weeks.

item.title: Satirical Bezos mannequins pop up in Venice ahead of wedding
item.description: Unflattering installations depicting Amazon founder and his bride-to-be are attracting attention in the Italian city.

item.title: Anna Wintour stepping back from editorial duties at U.S. Vogue
item.description: Anna Wintour, the global editorial director of Vogue and an influential voice in fashion, is stepping back from editorial duties.
